The heaviest elephant ever recorded, shot in Angola in 1974, was a bull estimated to weigh 12,000 kg, with a shoulder height of 3.96 metres.

The African bush elephant is the largest living terrestrial animal, with a maximum recorded weight of 13,000 kg (13 tonnes) for a bull from Angola weighing 8,000 kg (8.0 tonnes) for a cow from South Africa.
